{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561332,"name":"","username":"JaxsonSP","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T01:07:42.843Z","cooked":"

I have made a post on this before but I have a lot more insights into the problem so I am making a new post.

Essentially our robots wheels function as expected until their desired angle becomes 90 or -90. When that happens the wheels go into this infinite loop where once they reach 90 the desired angle changes to -90 and they spin all the way around, repeating indefinitely. the loop is only broken when a new input is given. It is a little hard to describe so here is a video:

I believe that the problem must be with the optimize() and enableContinuousInput() functions, as the former states “if this is used with the PIDController class’s continuous input functionality, the furthest a wheel will ever rotate is 90 degrees.”

I am pretty inexperienced with robotics programing so I just used the official robotpy/examples//SwerveBot code and tried to convert it to work with our canSparkMax + CTRE can encoder setup I am assuming that is where the problem is. anyone have any ideas? We would really appreciate any help, here is our git repo in case anyone wants to take a look: GitHub - Jaxson098/9019-2025: code for team 9019 2025 season
